blocks: The hymn and versicle, page 79.

Blessed be the God and
Father of our Lord Jesus
Christ, the Father of mercies,
and the God of all consolation,
who comforteth us in all our
tribulations.

Benedictus Deus et Pater
Domini nostri Jesu Christi,
Pater misericordiarum et
Deus totius consolationis,
qui consolatur nos in omni
tribulatione nostra.
The other Postcommunions are given on page 99.

Being fed, O ord, with
heavenly dainties, we beseech
thee, that we may always
hunger after them, for by
them we have true life.
Through, etc.

elestibus, Domine, pasti
deliciis, quesumus, ut sem-
per eadem, per que veraci-
ter vivimus, appetamus.
Per Dominum.
POSTCOMMUNION

May this oblation, O God,
we beseech thee, cleanse, re-
new, govern, and protect us.
Through, ete.

Hee nos oblatio, Deus,
mundet, quesumus, et re-
novet, gubernet, et protegat.
Per Dominum.
SECRET

altavit me: non moriar, sed
vivam, et narrabo opera
Domini.

right hand of the Lord hath
exalted me: I shall not die,
but live, and shall declare the
works of the Lord.
CAPITULUM
The psalms and antiphons as on page 72.
VESPERS

COMMUNION
Mirabantur omnes de his, All wondered at the words
que procedebant de ore Dei. that came from the mouth of
God.
The other Secrets are given on page 98.
SIXTH SUNDAY AFTER EPIPHANY
